column4: why my ProFTPd isn't listening for any port? - http://pastebin.ca/1064513
it says that it's started, but netstat doesn't show that
so it is not running, have you checked the logs ?
thank you, I'll check them now
there is nothing in /var/log/proftpd/controls.log and proftpd.log and  cat /var/log/messages | grep ftp doesn't show anything
/var/log/deamon.log doesn't say anything about ProFTPd (grep ftp)
this is not a fix for your specific problem, but why proftpd instead of vsftpd ?
I thouth that proftd is the default one for Ubuntu
what Ubuntu users/developers sugest to use?
proftpd is avaialble on universe, vsftp is available on main
not really.. since sftp uses compression, they should provide you similar rates
neither they have an FTP client installed :P
